diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Idiopathic generalized epilepsy with overlap between phantom absences and juvenile myoclonic epilepsy
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's symptoms suggested narcolepsy; however, normal sleep latency and HLA testing ruled it out. Polysomnography (PSG) indicated mild OSA with generalized spike-wave discharges on EEG, leading to a diagnosis of idiopathic generalized epilepsy (IGE) characterized by phantom absences and myoclonic seizures.
